Canticle.
The meaning of this verse is

O King, the Supreme Personality of Godhead Hari, who treated me exactly like an intimate
friend, has left me alone.

even the demigods, is no longer with me.
So immediately Arjuna's response is that the Supreme Lord has returned to his abode
and Arjuna is feeling separation from that dear most Lord Krishna.
And the immediate response of Arjuna is that Arjuna's astounding power, which he displayed
in the presence of Krishna, is no longer with Arjuna.
And that power was astounding even to the greatest of demigods in the heavenly planets.
And that power is no longer with Arjuna.

Prashila Prabhupada says, no one therefore can be independently powerful in any measure without being endowed by the Lord. So if I have any wealth, it is bestowed upon me by Krishna.

Now, if somebody else has more wealth or less wealth than me, even they are having that greater wealth or lesser wealth bestowed by Krishna only. Everyone's strength, everyone's beauty, everyone's knowledge.
It is a portion of Krishna's knowledge.

Now further, Srila Prabhupada explains, when the Lord descends on the earth along with his eternal, ever-liberated associates, he not only displays the divine energy possessed by himself, but also empowers his associate devotees with the required energy to execute his mission of incarnation.

Now further Srila Prabhupada says, the Lord takes away with him all his associates when
he disappears from the earth.
The power and energy which were bestowed upon Arjuna were required for fulfillment of the
mission of the Lord.
But when his mission was fulfilled, the emergency powers were withdrawn from Arjuna.
Arjuna was bestowed some extraordinary powers by Krishna, but when the mission was over,
Krishna withdrew the powers of Arjuna.
Why?
Because Prabhupada says, because the astounding powers of Arjuna, which were astonishing even
to the denizens of heaven or the demigods, were no longer required.
As they were not meant for going back home, back to Godhead.
So now what Arjuna requires to do is to go back to Godhead, because that's where he actually
is eternally present.
He had come when Krishna came along with Krishna for the sake of participating Krishna's
pastimes.
So when Krishna's pastimes are wound up, then Arjuna's powers are gone.
Then Arjuna's power is also withdrawn by Krishna.
It is Krishna only who gave Arjuna the power, extraordinary power.
And Krishna only withdraws it when the power is no longer required by Arjuna.
So that extraordinary power is not required for Arjuna to go back home, back to Godhead.
If endowment of powers and withdrawal of powers by the Lord are possible even for a great
devotee like Arjuna, or even for the demigods in heaven, then what to speak of ordinary
living beings who are but fixed compared to such great souls, even any person in this
world, however great he or she maybe.
They display certain extraordinary power or knowledge or strength or skill or wealth because

it is best utilized in the service of Krishna.
If you have any power, if you have any skill,

That's a lesson to be learned.
